sections.heading: This Article shall be known as the Probation Challenge Program Act.
sections.text: This Article shall be known as the Probation Challenge Program Act.

sections.heading: The purpose of this Act is to provide an intensive program of
sections.text:
educational instruction, as well as social and vocational counseling, to
certain convicted criminal defendants in an effort to
afford them a realistic opportunity to employ their latent talents and
abilities and become contributing members of the society in which they live.

sections.heading: For the purposes of this Act, the following words have the
sections.text: meanings ascribed to them in this Section.

sections.heading: There is created in each county having a  population of 2,000,000
sections.text:
or more inhabitants, for the purpose of operating on an experimental basis,
a Probation Challenge Program. The State shall bear the costs necessary to
carry out the functions of the Program.

sections.heading: The Program shall be governed by the Board of City College of
sections.text:
Chicago. The Board shall
prescribe such rules as may be necessary to assure the efficient
and effective operation of the Program, including but not limited to
rules establishing qualifications for Program employees.

sections.heading: To the fullest extent practicable, the Board shall provide
sections.text:
for the utilization of the facilities of community colleges within each
county having a population of 2,000,000 or more inhabitants in the
administration of this Act.

sections.heading: The Board shall appoint a Program Director who shall act as
sections.text:
a chief operating officer and shall devote his full time to supervising
the overall operation and fiscal affairs of the Program. The Program Director's
duties as supervisor of the Program include but are not limited to the hiring
of an Educational Coordinator, a Counselor Supervisor, a Psychologist and
an Administrator for the Program, and acting as a liaison between the
Program and the county Adult Probation Department in an effort to foster
cooperation between the Program and such Department in accomplishing the
purposes of this Act and to avoid the Program's duplicating services
already being adequately provided by such Department.

sections.heading: (a) The Educational Coordinator shall be responsible for the
sections.text:
overall planning, development and operation of the educational training
of clients of the Program and the hiring and supervision of instructors for
the Program.

sections.heading: The salaries of the Program Director and all supervisors and
sections.text: employees of the Program shall be determined by the Board.

sections.heading: At his initial meeting with the client, the Counselor
sections.text:
Supervisor shall arrange meetings between the client and the Educational
Coordinator and between the client and a counselor whom the Counselor
Supervisor shall assign to the client. The Counselor Supervisor shall also
arrange a private meeting between the client and the Program Psychologist.

sections.text:

sections.heading: All files of the Program regarding a client shall be
sections.text:
confidential. Access to such files shall be limited to personnel of the
Program, personnel of the court which required the client's participation
in the Program, the county Adult Probation Department and other persons and
entities to whom the Board may by rule
grant such access.
